snippet.description: Help. Contact Us. About ANSS Comprehensive Catalog. Earthquake Hazards Program. In Partnership With. Please click the list, map or options icon from above.

snippet.title: Earthquake Hazards Program
snippet.description: The USGS Earthquake Hazards Program is part of the National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program (NEHRP), established by Congress in 1977.

snippet.title: Earthquake \- Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
snippet.description: An earthquake (also known as a quake, tremor or temblor) is the result of a sudden release of energy in the Earth's crust that creates seismic waves.

snippet.title: Recent Earthquakes for Los_Angeles - (SCEC) Data Center
snippet.description: Maps are updated within about 5 minutes of an earthquake or once an hour. Brown lines represent known hazardous faults or fault zones. White lines are roads.

snippet.title: Earthquake | FEMA.gov
snippet.description: NEHRP logo. National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program (NEHRP) ... Visit the USGS Earthquake Hazards Program to learn about earthquakes worldwide.

snippet.title: HowStuffWorks "How Earthquakes Work"
snippet.description: Earthquakes shake our world every 11 seconds. Find out what causes earthquakes, how fault lines work and learn how earthquakes are monitored.

snippet.title: Earthquakes 2014 - News & Articles About Earthquakes | ...
snippet.description: Read the latest news and articles about earthquakes. Earthquakes are the result of plate tectonics, or shifting plates in the crust of Earth.
